lines.text: I would like to live in a castle.

[to Catherine, after kissing her]
That's the first time in years I've kissed a woman without saying "Goodbye," "Good Night" or "Happy Birthday."
A lucky guess. You should trust your emotions more. Stop think so much. I guess weight too.
Well, I'll be... can you beat... you know you don't look married.

I never was very good with animals. I get this dog that barks at me when I come home. Well, that isn't as strange as it sounds. He came with the house. He belonged to the former owner. And he doesn't know that I'm his master. He thinks I'm a prowler... so he barks.

[In the elevator]
I don't mean to sound too forward. My name is Catherine.
I never know what to say in an elevator
Some party good or some party bad?
Ah... some good or some bad. On the average for that type of party, I'd say it was... average.

[Looking at his piece of sculpture]
What does it say to you?
Oh, it's... shouldn't there be something on it?
The less that's on it, the more that's in it. That's art today. In any case, the safest response is, "It makes it's own quiet statement." And you can bet your ass it cost me a bundle.
I'm supposed to be your new... secretary.
Oh, sure. You're the one with... How are you?

[Leans towards him]
You want a pill?
No. Thank you. Would you get my wife... on the phone?
Is that what you want me to call you?
Well, yeah. Or you can call me Mr. Brubaker or Howard or actually whatever you want.
Good. I'm used to working for swingers.
You don't understand. It was nothing like that. See, she's... she's a princess and I'm a frog who got changed into a prince.
Now I was a prince at first.
But then I got changed into a frog until her kiss.
As cruel as that may seem in your current state, I want you to recognize that as the truth.
I'm not a frog now. I'm a prince. But I was a frog.
Brubaker, repeat this simple sentence after me. "I am not now nor have I ever been a frog."
Repeat, Brubaker. "I am not now nor have I ever been a frog."
[Shakes his head and starts to leave]
Brubaker. You need some rest. You also need to consult a doctor. Either a psychiatrist... or a veterinarian.
Gunther's the name. Buy you a drink?
No. My husband doesn't like children.
He thinks their too... too childish.
I feel wonderful. I met a girl last night and we're going to Paris.
What are you talking about? What about Phyllis?
She's not coming. I want you to handle it. That's what I wanted to see you about. Give her anything she wants... the car, the house...
It's too late. When there's no love...
Love? What's love got to do with it? This is the 20th century!
